aslsd.kernels package

Submodules

aslsd.kernels.kernel module

class aslsd.kernels.kernel.KernelModel(_basis_kernels, n_basis_ker=0, is_null=None, vec_n_param=None, n_param=0, ix_map=None, interval_map=None, phi=None, diff_phi=None, psi=None, diff_psi=None, upsilon=None, diff_sim_upsilon=None, diff_cross_upsilon=None, allow_simu=True, sim_func=None, l1_norm=None, diff_l1_norm=None, l2_norm=None, l2_dot=None, l2_distance=None, kl_divergence=None, diff_kl_divergence=None)

Bases: object

Class for parametric kernel models of MHP.

Let \(\theta\) denote the vector of parameters of the kernel. A kernel \(\phi_{\theta}\) is a sums of basis kernels \(\Big(f^{(r)}_{\vartheta^{(r)}}\Big)_{r \in [n_b]}\), \(n_b \geq 1\).

For all \(t \geq 0\), define

\[\phi_{\theta}(t) := \sum_{r=1}^{n_{\textrm{b}}} f^{(r)}_{\vartheta^{(r)}}(t).\]

The vector of parameters of kernel \(\phi_{\theta}\) is obtainend by concatenating the vectors of parameters \(\vartheta^{(r)}\) of each of the \(n_b\) basis kernels.

Parameters

_basis_kernels (BasisKernel or list or numpy.ndarray) – Array of events of basis kernels. If `BasisKernel`then broadcasted to a unidimensional list.
